reviews.review_msg: Jodie was just an absolutely wonderful prof! I thoroughly enjoyed her class every week, her expectations for the paper and the exams were clear and she was more than happy to discuss things with you outside of class time as well. Really disappointed that I won't be able to take any more courses with her for my degree, she was a real gem!

Very nice teacher! knows a lot about what shes teaching and is very funny! Exams are pretty difficult and is all written answers, she uses a lot of case studies and examples from the textbook so i definitely recommended buying it! nothing too hard, if you show up to class and take notes itll be easy

Jodie is a great prof! Her lectures are sometimes boring as she reads off the slides but its smart to take notes on top of the notes to help you get a better understanding of the material. This class was pretty interesting, don't let the science part scare you... its all memorization. If Jodie herself marks then you're good to go! Great prof!

Jodie's one of my favorite prof's! She's funny, sweet, and very approachable. Exams are difficult, and the average for them were pretty low (like 65%) as they're all short answer and the final is cumulative, but if you study for them its completely fair and manageable. I'd love to take more classes with her!

I liked Jodie and took 355 Forensics because I though it would be interesting, and it was! However this is the hardest class I have taken and I took it as an elective. The exams were huge, extremely long, cumulative and a LOT of work. Interesting topic but HARD exams that are worth 70% of your grade.

Such a sweet and caring professor. Her lectures come straight from the book making it unnecessary - focus on lecture slides, read the summary at the end of chapters. Records lectures. Totally fair exams and projects. Definitely drop by her office hours.

shes super sweet!! felt bad for her cause no one would laugh at her jokes :( reads directly off slides. i didnt buy a textbook which was ok because he lecture is like a straight copy of the textbook. she records he lectures and posts full lecture slides so not many people showed up to class. tutorials really boost your mark so dont skip those

Her slides are straight from the textbook, and in lectures she read straight from them. Both the midterm and final were mc and written but the written on the midterm were super difficult. The essay and presentation were fairly easy and tutorial participation brought my mark up a lot.

Jodie is a LOVELY lady. She is super kind, funny, and understanding. However, I found that it was difficult to grasp concepts in class since she basically taught straight from the textbook and had nothing more to add to help understand the material better. I felt I would leave the class having to reteach myself content.

Fair exams, they covered everything that she said it was going to cover. I wasted money on textbook, because the exams were heavy on lectures. However, she did an amazing job at going over everything from the textbook, in the lectures. She is a great prof, is crazy smart, and cares for her students. I would definitely take another course with her.

Great prof, super caring and sweet! Yet she heavily relies on the slides and provides little to no explanation beyond the textbook. Her lectures EXACTLY follow the textbook. Exams were straightforward and fair as she explain they would be.

Jodie is one of my favourite profs at SFU. I've taken two of her classes and would definitely take another in the future. She's very knowledgeable and quite funny. Very pleasant to be around. I wish her the best on her future endeavours!

Incredibly sweet woman with a lot of knowledge in her field. I've had Jodie as both a TA and prof and considerable her one of the best. Super approachable and clear of her expectations! Respects her students and genuinely wants them to succeed. Would recommend a million times over!

Jodie is one of my favourite profs at SFU. Although she's Gail's student, I feel that she is just as knowledgeable and is so approachable. She gives you a lot of advice for the midterm and the final so there are no surprises. She gives you lots of help for the term paper and encourages you to ask her questions. Would love to take classes with her

Jodie-Ann Warren is fantastic! Interesting and engaging speaker, her lectures are great. Great sense of humour and has exceptional knowledge in forensic science. Midterm and Final are marked fairly - you do need to study and read in her class! Will definitely take future classes with her.
Jodie is my TM for this class, and I absolutely Love her:) Not a crim major so I won't have a chance to take a class with her, but definitely recommend her.

I took this class online. Both her exams are all short written questions. Make sure you stay on top of the readings if you want to do well. Good thing is you kinda bs on the exams if you somewhat know the general ideas.

Jodi is a  nice prof, however her lectures are quite pointless. She reads off the slides and does not have a very interesting voice. She provided a good review outline for the midterm, however her final completely blindsided us and did not cover the material she said it would cover.

Jodie is the best prof she is super sweet you can ask her anything and she will do her best to answer! Her mt and final are fair according to the material & she will prep you very well for it. Her lectures are very interesting and take notes and pay attention she will give you clues into what will be tested! I would def take another class with her!
fair

very helpful exams not so easy. The midterm was brutal even though she gave us study questions. She made the final easier based on everyones average on the midterm. Final much easier. Overall very nice helpful and wants her students to do well. I would take her again.

Took this class via distance ed. The paper was very fun to write! Jodie was also very helpful in preparing us for both the midterm and final exams. The study guide served as a very good tool for prepping for the exam as well. The exams are not difficult if you make good use of the study guide.

Interesting Class. The paper was fun to write! Jodie was very helpful since she provided a review for both the midterm and the final exam to guide our studying. The study guide is VERY helpful to prep for the exam. The exam is very fair.

Took this by distance ed. Pretty simple, straightforward class. Prof and TM's way too lenient with students handing things in late. Exams are challenging, essay was fun (based on TV show). Weekly exercises were easy, but some were ridiculous. No, I'm not going to buy a candle and a chisel to do one question worth less than 1%.
Interesting course, Jodie was fair and helpful, exams were certainly not easy, but not difficult either. Involves a great deal of memorization.
Jodie is a great teacher. She is truly kind and cares about how you do in the class. I am so happy to be taking a second course with her this semester.

Jodie is very sweet, helpful,& approachable.She makes class interesting by incorporating pictures to complement her lectures, showing videos, having a guest lecturer, & bringing items to class. Class consists of 1 midterm, 1 paper based on a CSI episode (pretty fun assignment), and 1 final.  Exams are all short answer, but she preps you well.
Nice and approachable. Slides are helpful for studying for MT/Finals.
